Pre-Game Insights: The Cincinnati Reds are aiming for a series sweep against the Pittsburgh Pirates.
Cincinnati has a 39-41 record in home games and a 76-80 overall record.
Pittsburgh has a 72-83 overall record and a 34-43 record in road games.
The Pirates are 39-18 in games where they did not give up a home run.
Sunday's game is the 13th meeting between the two teams this season, with the Pirates leading 7-5.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Elly De La Cruz leads Cincinnati with 25 home runs and a.479 slugging percentage.
Bryan Reynolds leads the Pirates with a.276 batting average and 22 home runs.
Cincinnati is 53-13 in games where they out-hit their opponents.
Pittsburgh's last 10 games show a.239 batting average and a 4.76 ERA.
